intro: Myrcia selloi var. australis, commonly known as the Australian myrtle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, glossy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or rainforest habitats. Myrcia selloi var. australis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in indigenous cultures.
